channel.title: Marion Di Marco (née Weller)
channel.description: Recent content on Marion Di Marco (née Weller)

item.title: Concepts and Applications in NLP
item.description: Winter Semester 2024/2025 Masters Seminar: Concepts and Applications in NLP This seminar introduces linguistic background and essential topics in Natural Language Processing. The seminar starts with providing an overview of linguistic concepts and methods, such as morphology, part-of-speech tagging and grammars. We will then look at different applications. The seminar aims at providing a broad overview over different topics of NLP. Location: Room D2.11 Time: Tuesday 14:15 – 15:45 Lectures

item.title: Generative Models on Text
item.description: Sommer Semester 2025 Masters Seminar: Generative Models on Text Large Language Models (such as GPT2, GPT3, GPT4, Llama, T5) and Intelligent Chatbots (such as ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini and Copilot) are a very timely topic. Contents: N-gram language models, neural language modeling, word2vec, RNNs, Transformers, BERT, RLHF, ChatGPT, multilingual alignment, prompting, transfer learning, domain adaptation, linguistic knowledge in large language models Instructors: Prof. Alexander Fraser, Marion Di Marco Location: Room D.2.11

item.title: Home
item.description: I am a researcher at the School of Computation, Information and Technology at Technische Universität München (TUM). My main research interest is the representation of linguistic information in Large Language Models and Machine Translation. I am also interested in compounds, collocations and idiomatic expressions. E-mail: marion.dimarco -AT- tum.de

item.title: Introduction to Natural Language Processing
item.description: Winter Semester 2025/2026 Lecture: Introduction to Natural Language Processing Instructors: Marion Di Marco and Lukas Edman Location: Room D.2.11 Time: Tuesday 16:15 – 17:45 (Lecture) Thursday 16:15 – 17:45 (Excercise) Material see course Moodle Literature Speech and Language Processing Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin (2024; 3rd ed. draft)

item.title: Large Language Models
item.description: Sommer Semester 2025 Bachelors Seminar: Large Language Models Large Language Models (such as GPT2, GPT3, GPT4, Llama, T5) and Intelligent Chatbots (such as ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini and Copilot) are a very timely topic. Contents: N-gram language models, neural language modeling, word2vec, RNNs, Transformers, BERT, RLHF, ChatGPT, multilingual alignment, prompting, transfer learning, domain adaptation, linguistic knowledge in large language models Instructors: Prof. Alexander Fraser, Marion Di Marco Location: Room D.2.11 Time: Tuesday 16:15 – 17:45

item.title: Publications
item.description: 2025 Tsedeniya Kinfe Temesgen, Marion Di Marco, Alexander Fraser (2025): Extracting Linguistic Information from Large Language Models: Syntactic Relations and Derivational Knowledge. Proceedings of the 2025 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP 2025). Suzhou/China. Shu Okabe, Daryna Dementieva, Marion Di Marco, Lukas Edman, Katharina Haemmerl, Marko Měškank, Anita Hendrichowa, Alexander Fraser (2025): Findings of the WMT 2025 Shared Task LLMs with Limited Resources for Slavic Languages: MT and QA.
